position.description:
Toronto, ON
Full-time, Permanent
Why join us?
Within the Pension Operations Division, the Projects and Reporting Team is responsible for providing coordination, planning, monitoring and delivery of various initiatives that require involvement and coordination from multiple departments. The initiatives will cross a broad range of pension services business processes that deal with the life cycle of a member (enrolments, terminations, disability, marriage breakdowns, buyback purchases and inter plan transfers).
The Projects and Reporting Team provides oversight that will drive standards, consistency and best practices to ensure all business areas impacted are compliant and implementation of new initiatives are successful. The team is also responsible for analysis and delivery of data insights, dashboards and performance metrics, including the quarterly Pension Services Report, and will serve as a data gateway to ensure proper due diligence and security protocols are undertaken in the production of pension data and its transmittal within and outside of OMERS.
Reporting to the Manager, Projects and Reporting, the Senior Pension Analyst will be responsible for performing research and analysis, developing pension solutions, carrying out project management responsibilities and developing a broad range of reports. The Senior Pension Analyst will work collaboratively across several lines of business within OMERS to ensure that appropriate support is provided for various pension initiatives and that decisions are implemented effectively. The successful candidate will interact with internal and external stakeholders and will uphold and demonstrate the OMERS vision and core mission at all times.
As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
Participate in or lead project work on special initiatives (e.g., expanding OMERS pension data capabilities), and ensure that they are executed effectively and efficiently
Lead the research and analysis on a broad range of pension data and issues, develop thoughtful and effective recommendations, provide detailed documentation and implement the decisions made
Manage and ensure annual tasks, quarterly and annual compliance reports are completed appropriately and within established timeframes
Assist in the development of strategies and tools to deliver on the mandate and objectives of the Projects and Reporting team
Support other initiatives within Pension Operations, as required
To succeed in this role, you have:
5 years of pension (e.g., actuarial, pension administration, policy) or relevant experience. Knowledge of the OMERS Plan, systems and processes is an asset.
University degree or equivalent
Ability to multi-task and prioritize to ensure tasks are completed on a timely basis
Strong written and oral communication skills, including preparation of presentation decks
Ability to influence and drive task completion
Conceptual thinker with strong analytical skills, including the ability to research and analyze complex issues, develop insightful solutions, while considering risks, costs to the plan and stakeholders’ views
Excellent attention to detail with a focus on accuracy
Our story:
Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $97 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2018. A jointly sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers, OMERS invests and administers pensions on behalf of almost half a million active and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS has employees in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. For more information on OMERS, visit www.omers.com .
OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. Diversity and Inclusion at OMERS means we respect and value the broadest range of experiences, geographies, gender, ethnicities and perspectives as key elements of our culture. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise if you require accommodation.

Toronto, ON
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
Compensation Advisory is a function within TD's Global Total Rewards group. We are the in-house compensation consulting team that provides advice and tailored compensation solutions for each business group based on their respective strategy and business requirements.
Job Description
Job Description
The Sr. Compensation Analyst will report to the Senior Manager, Compensation Advisory, delivering professional research, high-quality analytics and technical services to one of TD's lines of business that support the design, development, implementation and evaluation of compensation policies and programs. This role will support the Corporate Office portfolio.
Key accountabilities of this role include:
Complete all aspects of the market intelligence process including research, end-to-end employee matching, data validation, interpretation and professional presentation of findings for TD's line of business;
Prepare detailed compensation analytics and models as needed to support both cyclical and ad-hoc project-related deliverables;
Support all compensation recommendations with market intelligence expertise and equity valuations;
Monitor trends in the external market;
Support the team of Advisors with professional business-related research and analysis.
Job Requirements
Key Competencies
Analytical/conceptual thinking: Strong skills in numeracy, mathematics and analytics, with the ability to analyze large amounts of data, identify trends and provide succinct explanations behind the data.
Project management: Well organized with strong project management skills and able to adapt to changing priorities within a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment.
Learning agility: A self-initiated learner who actively seeks out experiences, enjoys complex problems and leverages a combination of theory and experience to quickly solve complex problems.
Persuasive communicator: Strong written and verbal communication skills with ability to tell a compelling story with data to create persuasive recommendations.
Accountability & Ownership: Someone with a focus on accuracy, who sees a job through right to the end and owns the results without blame or excuses.
Process Efficiency: A focus on building models / processes to help complete deliverables in a quick and efficient manner.
Additional Job Requirements
Undergraduate degree, preferably in Business Management, Human Resources / Labour Relations, Mathematics or Economics;
Direct experience in a Compensation role is an asset;
Working towards CCP (Certified Compensation Professional) designation would be considered an asset;
3+ years of relevant experience.
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Toronto, ON
Full-time, Permanent
$45.47 - $49.82 an hour
Job ID: 5261
Job Category: Information & Technology
Division & Section: Parks, Forestry & Recreation, PFR Policy & Strategic Planning
Work Location: METRO HALL, 55 John Street
Job Type & Duration: Full-time, Permanent Vacancy
Hourly Rate and Wage Grade: Preliminary, $45.47 - $49.82, Please note: The salary reflects 2019 rates
Shift Information: Monday to Friday, 35 hours Per Week
Affiliation: L79 Full-time
Number of Positions Open: 1
Posting Period: 26-Feb-2020 to 11-Mar- 2020
Job Description
Working in the Business Intelligence, Research and Analytics unit in the Policy and Strategic Planning Branch of PFR, you are a data engineering professional who works collaboratively on solving complex problems for a division that stewards public spaces and brings the public together. You'll be working directly with staff in data science, data engineering, and a variety of business functions, on building pipelines and optimization models. With access to a variety of data sources internally and externally to the City of Toronto, there's no shortage of data and problems to tackle. Most importantly, you can seamlessly distill very technical concepts to business users and vice versa; bringing colleagues and stakeholders along the journey of discovery and learning through data analytics is very important to you.
Major Responsibilities:
Data Science, Research and Analytics
Provides technical expertise in using data analysis techniques to City divisions to support of data driven decision making.
Leads development and supports the coordination of corporate analytical models.
Implements industry best practices on machine learning, artificial intelligence, and digital twinning, resulting in operational improvements and project success.
Uses data science to formulate solutions and/or recommendations.
Creates and uploads for dissemination and/or planned email reporting.
Compiles data/statistical reports based on data analysis.
Produces data visualization on a range of different data sources, including structured, unstructured, real-time and geospatial.
Troubleshoots and takes actions to resolve issues associated to data, interpretation and reporting.
Data Engineering
Builds core ETLs/ELT, refactor queries and data models, and provide strong analytics to support the decision making process.
Supports data pipelines, builds queries and ETLs/ELTs, and supports statistical and inferential analysis. Integrates a variety of business data and analyzes data to gain additional insights.
Connects to and transforms data from each source to match the format and schema of its destination.
Coordinates and collaborates with Corporate I&T BI team to ensure high performance of large amounts of ETL as well as ELT tasks, report building, analytics, and data visualization support.
Data Quality and Governance
Develops data quality evaluation processes.
Guides the creation and maintenance of data dictionaries and metadata.
Ensures data quality and performs data cleansing.
Provides technical support to divisional teams in the development, use, and quality assurance of data collection methods (including geospatial) for business intelligence and analytics. Produces technical documents pertaining to data analytic processes, analysis, methods and models.
Participates in design and evaluation sessions of data analytics and machine learning processes with objectives to conduct testing, devise audits and support implementations.
Stakeholder support and Communication
Develops, fosters and maintains effective working relationships and communication with internal and external stakeholders on project requirements and approaches related to data analysis, visualizations, data quality, and project delivery timelines.
Participates in business requirement workshops and supports the documentation of business requirements.
Builds relationships and liaises with key business users and decision makers to understand their business analytics needs.
Represents the team and gives presentations at relevant learning networks, meetings and events related to data science. Delivers presentations based on findings.
Maintains up-to-date knowledge of both the current and emerging data analytics technology and products.
Provides direction to the Data Analyst & Integrator regarding data analysis as related to data structures and architecture.
Key Qualifications:
Your application must describe your qualifications as they relate to:
Post-secondary education in Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent combination of education and experience, or a related field.
Considerable experience with big data processing frameworks and techniques such as HDFS, MapReduce, Syncsort, Sqoop, Oozie, etc.
Considerable experience using programming or scripting languages like Java, Linux, C++, Python, or R.
Considerable experience writing complex SQL and NoSQL jobs to analyze data in both traditional DBMS (MS-SQL, Oracle) and Big Data environments (i.e., HADOOP, SPARK, or similar open source and commercial technologies).
Experience with data streaming using Kafka, Apache Spark and data ingestion frameworks: NiFi, Hive and Pig.
Experience with predictive analytics and machine learning (scikit-learn, Tensorflow, MLlib, recommendation systems).
You must also have:
Ability to structure and transform data to enable analysis.
Collaborative attitude, willingness to work with team members; with the ability to coach, participate in code reviews, share skills and methods.
Exceptional oral, written and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to simplify complex technical concepts into business & value-focused language.
Ability to communicate clearly and consistently keeping stakeholders well-informed of progress and challenges.
Excellent organizational and time management skills, strong business presence with the ability to multi-task and effectively deal with competing priorities.
Excellent interpersonal skills, critical thinking, problem solving and conflict resolution skills.
Ability to develop and maintain inter-professional team relationships with multiple stakeholders, including City staff and the public.
Excellent political acuity.
Ability to create and effectively present information and facilitate discussions with various audiences.
Ability to travel to various locations in Toronto.
Notes
Priority consideration will be given to applicants with Local 79 seniority or aggregate service as of the job posting closing and job offer dates
Applicants are required to demonstrate in their resume/cover letter that their qualifications match those specified in the job posting. Additional information submitted after the job posting closing date will not be accepted
Assessment may include an interview, written and/or practical test. Location of assessment to be determined
Work location reflects what is known at the time of posting
An employee's reporting relationship and/or work location may change due to operational reasons and in accordance with the Local 79 Full-time Collective Agreement
Information in preparing for City job competitions is available on the Job Opportunities website
Equity, Diversity and Inclusion
The City is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating a workplace culture of inclusiveness that reflects the diverse residents that we serve.
Accommodation
The City of Toronto is committed to creating an accessible and inclusive organization. We are committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Should you require Code-protected accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please make them known when contacted and we will work with you to meet your needs. Disability-related accommodation during the application process is available upon request.

The Position

The Individual Contributor in Business Insights & Analytics (BI&A) is a strategic thought partner to key stakeholders and an integral contributor to Genentech’s operational planning efforts.
The specific role of Operations Data Analyst requires a mix of Forecasting, Data Analytics and Advanced Data Analytics capabilities. However, all Individual Contributors have the opportunity to blend and extend their expertise on different initiatives to further develop both the breadth and depth of their capabilities.
He/she is responsible for providing strategic operational insights with minimal guidance / supervision, leveraging their capabilities in the following areas of expertise:
Forecasting: creating time-series and/or patient-based forecasts; conducting uncertainty analyses
Data Analytics: designing and delivering advanced quantitative data analyses leveraging large/complex datasets
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES
Work with Team Leads (TLs), Franchise Leads, Study Management & Country Leaders, Study Management Teams, LSPC stakeholders, Lifecycle Teams to understand business needs and priorities, as well as immediate scope of work Create and manage tools with up-to-date industry information to build accurate short-and long-term forecasts Work with other team members to pull in insights from primary and secondary data, to continuously improve forecast methods and accuracy Communicate the effects that trial design elements, country and site selection, competitor activities and new engagement tactics will have on clinical trial recruitment & retention forecasts Provide technical/analytical expertise to team through secondary data analytics Apply analytical and statistical methods to answer a variety of business questions using multiple data sources and technical tools Monitor and assess the effectiveness of enrollment and engagement efforts, projects, and practices and identify opportunities to optimize value of investments Support the identification of appropriate sites and countries for trial placement Increase the sophistication and application of advanced analytics methods (including predictive modeling, machine learning, and scalable prototypes) to measure study performance and guide portfolio-level decisions efficiently and at the speed of business Act as subject matter expert for applicable advanced analytical methodologies, programs and projects Collaborate within cross-functional teams to develop solutions, gain alignment and deliver impactful business insights; engage necessary stakeholders to enable better decision-making Openly share perspective and insights to elevate team thinking and drive a balanced, holistic point of view; effectively weigh and communicate trade-off considerations Take an enterprise and One PDG mindset, linking individual responsibilities with broader organization; focus on outcomes that provide most business value Demonstrate self-accountability and integrity Demonstrate strategic agility and an ability to engage stakeholders to understand and diagnose business problems and recommend appropriate courses of action Look for opportunities for continuous improvement; engage managers and peer group regularly for coaching, assistance, and advocacy Stay current with and adopt emergent relevant methodologies, tools and applications to ensure fit-for-purpose and impactful approaches. Act as a thought partner and advisor to all relevant teams and stakeholders; look for and establish opportunities for peer mentorship Actively participate in cross functional communities, networks and/or knowledge-sharing bodies that enable broader and more effective use of insights and/or analytics that drive and support decisions Acquire, aggregate and/or curate data and information
WHO YOU ARE
In Individual Contributors, we are looking for people who are nimble, curious, able to effectively collaborate and lend expertise to multi-functional teams and adapt quickly to competing priorities within their Disease Area. We are also looking for people who are committed to continuing to make Genentech a great place to work, by seeking opportunities to develop their own and others’ expertise through ongoing mentorship and coaching.
"Self-starter"; strong sense of responsibility with demonstrable comfort in an entrepreneurial environment
Able to work effectively in a fluid, cross-functional, global matrixed environment and stand out as a successful collaborator
Strong interpersonal skills and a consultative mindset, with the ability to develop strong partnerships
Good problem-solving ability, breaking down complex problems into distinct parts, managing uncertainty, understanding, anticipating interdependencies
Able to proactively “connect the dots” by asking thought-provoking questions
Objective when presenting insights and guiding decision-making; demonstrate good presentation skills by pairing sound analytics with storytelling
Motivated to continuously improve performance; outcomes-focused and driven to achieve objectives
Able to lean in and manage through change
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree (Business, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or Physical Sciences or related field is a plus); MBA or Graduate-level Degree is preferred
7+ years of work experience with Bachelors; 5+ year of work experience with Masters; 4+ years of work experience with PhD/JD, preferably within pharmaceutical or biotech industry (commercial or clinical) and/or management consulting
Deep expertise in at least one of the following areas: Patient Insights, Investigator Insights, Forecasting, Competitive Intelligence, Data Analytics, Advanced Data Analytics, Resourcing, Information Visualization and/or Data Science
Experience with various forecasting methods and techniques preferred
Understands the advantages and limits of different analytical approaches
Considerable experience applying exploratory & confirmatory data analysis techniques that inform business decisions
Awareness of scripting, statistical & programming languages and analytical tools a plus (i.e. Python, Metlab, R, SAS, Google/Adobe analytics, SQL)
Autonomous or semi-autonomous examination of data or content
Demonstrated use of sophisticated techniques, tools & languages typically beyond those of traditional data analysis to discover deeper insights, make predictions, or generate recommendations
Experience acting as a strategic thought partner to teams; Entrepreneurial mindset, to transform the way we use data and analytics to enable decisions and hasten our delivery of medicines for our patients
Track record of effectively working in a matrix environment with international team members coming from scientific, business and operational backgrounds, using influence without authority
Expertise in standard analysis and presentation software (Excel, PowerPoint)
Ability to merge together data sets from disparate sources and report findings in a variety of formats and mediums
Persuasive written and verbal communication skills, easily communicating complex ideas.
Strong attention to detail
Experience managing outside vendors preferred
Who We Are
A member of the Roche Group, Genentech has been at the forefront of the biotechnology industry for more than 40 years, using human genetic information to develop novel medicines for serious and life-threatening diseases. Genentech has multiple therapies on the market for cancer & other serious illnesses. Please take this opportunity to learn about Genentech where we believe that our employees are our most important asset & are dedicated to remaining a great place to work.

Job Description
Reporting to the Finance Manager, ITSS Finance, supporting Technology Operations, this role will act as the Finance Team Lead supporting Darrell Currie (ITS VP) Infrastructre Service Assurance portfolio in the new ITS structure. Infrastructure Service Assurance has a annual cost budget of +$200MM. It is the biggest business unit within Technology Operation This roles includes providing financial analysis and insight to the Darrell and his management team. The candidate will be required to partner with finance and business colleagues across Technology. A successful candidate would be detail oriented and organized, with strong analytical and communication skills. This position requires an action oriented individual with strong knowledge of finance applications and data flows, demonstrated analytical/problem solving capabilities, strong relationship management skills and the ability to deal with change in a fast-paced and deadline driven environment.

Business Systems Analyst - AEM #31074
Request ID: 31074-1
Start/End Dates: 3/9/2020 - 3/8/2021
Job Title: IT - Business Systems Analyst - Senior
Job Description: Role Title: Business Systems Analyst - Senior
Line of Business: Technology & Operations
Target Start Date: March 9th, 2020 (ASAP)
Number of Positions: 1
Duration: 12 months from start date
Work Location: Toronto, 483 Bay St, near Queen St
Hours: Monday - Friday, 9:00 am – 5:00 pm. 37.50 hours/week. No overtime expected.
Possibility of Extension/Conversion: Extension possible. Conversion to full-time is not expected to be available.
Reason the Role is Open: Replacing contingent worker that is rolling off assignment.
Group Information: Business Systems Analysis team within Technology & Operations – This team is comprised of eight BSAs and are responsible for supporting a suite of products/technologies related to ECM, Kofax capture software, and Forms Management (Adobe Experience Manager – AEM). This role will be supporting the development team in the forms management space.
Job Responsibilities:
Writing user stories
Working through various intakes
Working with key stakeholders within all business functions to align technology solutions with business strategies.
Gathering requirements from business units and translates those to programmers and developers.
Preparing cost-benefit and return-on-investment analyses to aid in decisions on system implementation.
Demonstrating an informed knowledge of business functions to resolve problems and capitalize on improvement opportunities.
Supporting one or more highly complex business processes.
Working on multiple projects as a project team member.
Serving as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs.
Ensuring collection of information, accurate requirement gathering, data analysis, documentation of information, and presentation of findings advance initiatives and ensure project success.
Conducting analysis of client processes and functional or reporting requirements to prepare documentation and communicate the information.
Providing SME advice and direction to internal and external customers to ensure that the business requirements are appropriately defined.
Coordinating and leading cross-functional tasks or work packages to identify and document functional or reporting requirements, workflow, information sources and system specifications.
Partnering with project manager, technical resources, vendors, and management to ensure accurate execution of projects.

Job Description
Thomson Reuters is transforming its business to be Digital-First and is currently delivering a multi-year programme to streamline the way customers are able to self serve through Digital Channels. Critical to this effort is a Unified Digital Experience that means customers can interact with us digitally in a consistent and streamlined way whether they are finding out about our products, trialing them, buying and renewing or supporting. Our landscape is at multiple levels of maturity with a strong focus on Adobe Experience and Marketing Cloud technologies for channel web and emerging standards in middleware and back office to provide transactional functionality for purchasing and support.
Digital Experience will range across all parts of the customer journey lifecycle, be presented within multiple customer facing channels and evolve to support partners and developers as part of a wider Platforms ecosystem.
The role of Digital Experience Architect will initially be responsible for architectural definition and enablement of a unified Digital Experience across our customer self-service journey. The role will require the definition and creation of a performant, scalable and industry-leading client-facing experience approach and platform built on TR’s existing services architecture that will support the automated creation of marketing, sales and service content that can be seamlessly blended with transactional functionality to provide a rich, personalised and relevant customer self-service experience. It is envisaged that once the initial customer-facing work has been delivered that this role grow to support TR’s emergent Platform strategy by extending the Digital Experience to support Platform capabilities such as AppStore, “inside-out account management” and 3rd party communities such as developer portals and ecosystems.
The Digital Experience Architect will also provide direction and oversight to all parts of the delivery cycle, from initial solutions architecture delivery (for each component) through to delivery and operational support.
The Digital Experience Architect:
Is responsible for the definition, development, maintenance, communication and ongoing governance of Thomson Reuters Digital Experience Architecture, working with colleagues in the Enterprise Digital Office and Digital, Employee and Partner Technology (DEP Tech), and beyond. Responsible for ensuring the digital experience capabilities are fit-for-purpose, easy to understand and easy to adopt in a secure and scalable way.
Will provide a reference point for the digital experience design of systems and projects.
Will be required to have in depth knowledge of current and emerging Digital Experience technologies and how these technologies can be adopted to provide the best outcome for the Digital domain (in terms of functionality and commercially) (Content publishing and re-use, client-side frameworks, high performant caching and client-side APIs etc).
Will /May manage a small team of front end architects, and build strong working relationships with the network of specialists, delivery partners and primary stakeholders across the organisation.
Responsibilities
Responsible for delivering the end to end solution architecture for Digital Experience
Provide architecture design and thought leadership in the growing space of digital experience
Responsible for ensuring the architecture is scalable, meets quality requirements and delivers business objectives with the right back end systems integration
Responsible for ensuring that technical designs created by other teams within the project or programme comply with agreed architecture standards, best practices and are fit-for-purpose.
Prepares for and participates in the technical governance of projects & programmes at key stages – Technical Commitment Review, Project Commitment and Fitness For Launch
Provide point of contact for development staff, Enterprise Architects (EAs), and Principal Architect for issues in product delivery.
Document Technical Architecture Documentation in accordance with the agreed templates.
Agree with the Enterprise Architects on closure of any capability gaps for strategies, products and technologies deployed to support TR’s Digital goals.
Responsible for architectural reviews of Technical Architecture Documentation to the Principal Architect.
Actively engage with the team and other technology groups to ensure the solution is clearly articulated
Ensure Digital Experience architecture demand is appropriately resourced
Ensure output of the Digital Experience architecture is of good quality, timely and aligned with DEP Enterprise Foundational Architecture (EFA)
Creates and oversees the architectural design for medium and large sized projects consistent with long term technology strategy
Partner with solution architects, solution designers and enterprise architects on large projects to ensure that architectural design is consistent with long term technical strategy
Ensures that the Digital Experience architecture is communicated, understood and adhered to by the project teams within a domain area
Partners with customers, business analysts and other stakeholders to analyse requirements and provide design recommendations
Participate in DEP Architecture governance board and represent the Digital Experience architecture aspect of projects to highlight any business risks
Ownership
Digital Experience architecture for EDO and DEP – as part of wider Digital Enterprise Architecture
Digital Experience Solution Design
Demand management and resourcing of Digital Experience architecture
Required Skills
Technical:
Adobe Experience Manager and other web publishing and content authoring, repository and management technologies
Adobe Marketing Cloud technologies including Search & Promote, Target, Adobe Analytics (or equivalent from other vendors such as Oracle and Salesforce)
Client-side Javascript Frameworks including React and Angular
Content and feature caching technologies such as Kafka, DynamoDB
Integration of RESTful APIs, JSON & XML to client-side frameworks
Digital Asset Management and CDNs
Expert:
Digital Experience solution design
Digital Experience architecture development
Digital Experience policy formation
User Experience modelling and implementation
Digital experience re-usable component library creation and maintenance
Fully Competent:
Information systems design
Business scenario development
Stakeholder management
Global teaming and remote collaboration
Communications
Working Knowledge:
Usability design
Business domain analysis
Business process improvement
Business process modelling
Marketing and Campaign Management,
Web Content Management,
eCommerce
Web Analytics
Data integration
Product Information Mastering
Master and Meta Data Management
Key Deliverables
Definition and creation of a performant, scalable and industry-leading client-facing Digital Experience approach and platform built on TR’s existing services architecture that will support the automated creation of marketing, sales and service content that can be seamlessly blended with transactional functionality to provide a rich, personalised and relevant customer self-service experience.
Extending the Digital Experience to support Platform capabilities such as AppStore, “inside-out account management” and 3rd party communities such as developer portals and ecosystems.
In addition, deliver and maintain key architectural artefacts including, but not limited to, the following:
Detailed Roadmap & Capacity Plan
Detailed Continuous Availability and D/R Architecture covering BAU and ‘emergency’ configurations, and approach to testing and optimisation
Architectural Risk Model and ongoing Mitigation
Digital Experience Playbook / How To guides
Digital Component Library & Design Patterns
Overall Governance Model, Standards, Policies and Principles
Ensuring compliance with Data Security & Privacy Models Including safe and secure integration with Thomson Reuters business and product systems
At Thomson Reuters, we believe what we do matters. We are passionate about our work, inspired by the impact it has on our business and our customers. As a team, we believe in winning as one - collaborating to reach shared goals, and developing through challenging and meaningful experiences. With more than 25,000 employees in more than 100 countries, we work flexibly across boundaries and realize innovations that help shape industries around the world. Making this happen is a dynamic, evolving process, and we count on each employee to be a catalyst in driving our performance - and their own.
As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.
We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.
Intrigued by a challenge as large and fascinating as the world itself? Come join us.
To learn more about what we offer, please visit thomsonreuters.com/careers.
More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

Senior Analyst
Who we are
We are an organization comprised of industry thought leaders who are passionate about health data and want to make a difference in the health care field. We are an independent, not-for-profit organization and together with our partners we provide essential information on Canada's health systems, enabling decisions that lead to healthier Canadians. As a valued member of the CIHI team, you and your work will have a pivotal role in the evolution of Canada's health care systems.
CIHI is recognized as an exceptional place to work that embraces diversity, respect, integrity, collaboration and innovation.
At CIHI, we recognize what matters to our employees. Some of the benefits of working at CIHI include
Generous vacation days
Flexible benefits program from your first day on the job
HOOPP Pension Plan (Defined Pension)
Retirement Planning Program
Work-life balance
Career Planning Program
Learning and Professional Development Program
Why is this role important?
The Performance Improvement and Capacity Building (PICB) department works with stakeholders to increase capacity for using performance measurement and health information to inform health system improvement. In alignment with CIHI’s strategic goal to build the capacity of health system stakeholders to use health data and information to support decision-making through education and engagement, the department assists with the development of leading edge performance management products such as web based tools related to health system performance, as well as the development and delivery of capacity building activities such as workshops and e-learning products.
to support their use for quality improvement. PICB manages CIHI’s methodology development and reporting of acute care patient experience measures.
Working in a matrix style, team based environment, the Senior Analyst is responsible for carrying out data analysis, reporting, and other technical and writing activities related to the development, compilation, and verification of health system performance indicators and measures. The Senior Analyst supports the development of presentations and educational and capacity building materials, analytical plans related to the use of health system performance data and indicators. The Senior Analyst provides professional and timely technical support, communications, and other key client service assistance to stakeholders. The Senior Analyst may also act as a key member of teams responsible for other research projects related to health indicators or health services analyses and may work closely with members of the external research community to define data requirements and to collaborate on joint initiatives.
What you'll do
1. Responsible for the production and dissemination of health system indicators, including but not limited to data analysis, data verification, drafting reports and preparing presentations.
2. Participate in the methodological development of analytic methodologies for reporting health information such as developing benchmarking performance methods, instruments and reporting standards that support system capacity.
3. Provides professional and timely technical support to internal and external stakeholders.
4. Prepares technical documentation, interpretation and presentation materials as required to support the delivery of capacity building and e-learning offerings in the use of health system data, measures and information for health system performance management.
5. Responsible for the identification of user requirements for statistical data and deals appropriately with internal and external stakeholders when responding to requests for information or consultation.
6. Conducts ad hoc analyses to support special studies, liaising with key internal and external stakeholders to fully define data and/or analytical requirements.
7. Develops and maintains knowledge of CIHI's data holdings, related data held by other organizations, and tools used by CIHI to access these data holdings.
8. Maintains current knowledge about analytical techniques, health services and population health research, and stakeholder information needs.
9. Develops and maintains collaborative working relationships with a variety of internal and external clients, including program areas within and external to the branch, corporate support departments, and external committees, working groups and stakeholders.
10. Contributes in a matrix style environment to team based projects and mentors more junior staff.
11. Assumes responsibility for other related duties as assigned.
What you'll bring to the table
Undergraduate degree in epidemiology, statistics, and health services research, or similar fields. Graduate degree would be an asset.
Three to five years’ experience and knowledge in health indicators.
Sound conceptual knowledge of health indicators, determinants of health, the measurement of health status, health system performance and the Canadian health system.
Sound knowledge and experience in statistical analysis and the analysis of large administrative datasets, analytical tools, data linkage and reporting processes.
Strong SAS aptitude and experience in statistical analysis using administrative databases.
Extensive experience in client support and preparation of statistical and descriptive reports.
Experience in survey analyses and qualitative research and reporting would be an asset.
Experience with data modeling, forecasting, and machine learning using large data/datasets considered an asset.
Experience working with business intelligence tools and reporting (e.g. MicroStrategy) would be an asset.
Strong critical thinking skills and interpretation of analytic results.
Strong interpersonal, teamwork, and oral and written communication skills.
Fluency in both official languages is an asset.

Employment Equity

If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

position.description:
Toronto, ON
Full-time, Permanent
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada
Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.
The Senior Analyst, Operational Analytics and Planning will play an integral role in impacting strategy and growth objectives for our eCommerce business. This role is responsible for leveraging multiple data sources and tools, they will work directly with stakeholders across the business to identify, interpret and communicate insights and actionable recommendations to support growing eCommerce and improving the eCommerce customer experience and operational planning.
What you’ll do
Develop reporting for eCommerce operational metrics, analyze and interpret operational and sales performance, and provide key insights that translate into tactical recommendations to improve user experience and drive sales
Operational planning at category and store level, working with cross-functional teams to ensure forecast is consistent with business assumptions and integrated into the planning process
Partner with cross-functional partners (Finance, Operations, Digital) to provide data-driven support for ad-hoc or special projects and translate data into meaningful insights to help drive continuous improvement in our business
Combine multiple sources of data to provide seamless and self-serve operational reporting
Who you are
We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment
Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business
Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business
Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward
If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.
What you bring
Post-secondary education or equivalent in Business or related discipline
3-5 years of experience in Merchandising, Retail or an Analytics role
Solid understanding of SQL or other programming language for data extraction and manipulation
Experience building and managing reporting tools and dashboards to monitor business performance
Ability to analyze data, visualize and clearly communicate findings and insights to key stakeholders
Experience with operational planning related to volume or sales forecasting
Experience creating clear and concise analysis and decks for senior audiences
About Canadian Tire Corporation
Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies .
To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on LinkedIn .
#LI-TK1
Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. Canadian Tire Retail

Toronto, ON
Requisition ID: 83826
At Scotiabank Digital Factory, the reach and opportunity of a global organization meets the passion and drive of a startup. Reinvention starts here—and it starts with you.
We believe that the pathway to success is paved with user feedback, so we’re constantly asking our customers how they want to bank. When we find an opportunity to make things people will love, we assemble teams of specialists to collaborate in Digital Factories in Canada, Chile, Mexico, Peru, and Colombia. We work fast, and we work smart. Join us to create meaningful experiences and build the bank of tomorrow for our customers around the world.
If you’d like to learn more about the Digital Factory workspace, our Digital Banking career opportunities, Communities of Practice, and open source projects, check out our microsite: https://digitalfactory.scotiabank.com/
Summary of the role
As an Analyst, Digital Sales Strategy, you will be responsible for measuring, analyzing and managing performance of Digital Sales across multiple business lines to drive towards our strategic sales targets for Canadian Retail Banking. You will also be responsible for understanding how marketing, seasonality, campaign cycles and processes impact digital sales across all digital sales channels, including Authenticated (owned) and Public channels. As a member of the Digital Sales Growth & Engagement team, you will be involved in supporting digital sales reporting, in-year sales performance management and identifying opportunities to drive value through strategic initiatives. We're looking for someone firmly rooted in data-driven decision making, a strong understanding of Digital Banking and Banking products and the ability to effectively define, socialize and execute on strategy.
Is this role right for you?
Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
You will partner with Business lines, Digital Journey Managers, Digital Acquisition Specialists and other Marketers to ensure that Scotiabank positively performs to our annual and strategic digital sales targets
You will partner with Digital analytics to support monthly reporting and ad-hoc requests to generate insights in an effort drive performance management across multiple business lines and Digital Sales overall
You will partner with Product teams and Business Partners to provide a digital sales lens for ongoing and upcoming initiatives as a SME
You will help identify opportunities to drive digital sales in both the short term and long term
You will develop frameworks and processes to manage roadmaps and strategic initiatives
Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.
Champions a high performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.
Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed?
You have a bachelor’s degree, or related relevant work experience within digital sales environments
You have strong familiarity working with data sets and can effectively derive insights
You have 2 or more years of experience in Banking, Data Analysis and Reporting, or Business Strategy
You know how to identify opportunities through insights to drive performance for digital sales
You are experienced with building relationships and influencing decision making at senior levels of engagement
You have strong written and verbal communication skills with attention to detail.
You are passionate about aligning strategy to business goals
You have proven success working collaboratively within cross-functional and distributed teams based on strong team spirit, solid work ethic and good communication skills
Strong knowledge of Tableau and Adobe Analytics is considered an asset
What's in it for you?
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create beautiful customer experiences
You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
Dress codes don't apply here, being comfortable does
Free shuttle service to and from Union station, which means more money in your pocket
Onsite subsidized cafeteria with a chef, so you can snack all day, every day
Onsite fitness center, so you can feel your best
This isn't your typical "corporate" job. We work hard and we have fun!
Access to thousands of online and in person courses so you can brush up on skills, or learn new ones
Career progression opportunities. We hire you for your talent and not just for the job. We want to see you succeed not just in your role but in your career as a whole
A competitive rewards package that includes a base salary, a performance bonus, company matching programs on pension and profit sharing, paid vacation, personal & sick days, medical, vision and dental benefits that start from day one and much more!
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto
As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. Our employees are committed to a superior customer experience and use the Bank’s six guiding sales practice principles to ensure they act with honesty and integrity.
At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

About the Chartered Professional Accountants of Ontario
We protect the public. We advance our profession. We guide our CPAs. We ensure that our more than 93,000 members and 21,000 students meet the highest standards of integrity and expertise. We help them stay ahead of global market trends and abreast of regulatory change. CPAs represent a globally recognized, premium designation. Position Description:
CPA Ontario is currently in search of a highly skilled Financial Analyst to prepare and analyze business and management reports in support of CPA Ontario’s planning and decision-making processes.
Major Responsibilities:
Collaborate cross-functionally with leadership across the organization to understand and translate business objectives to ensure KPIs and budgets are on track
Perform financial monthly/quarterly reporting, variance analysis, and operational metrics tracking; communicate and analyze results with key stakeholders
Liaise with various Business Unit leads to formulate, analyze, and support the budgeting and forecasting process, and prepare PowerPoint decks/presentations that summarize the budget and forecast for the Senior Leadership Team
Support the budgeting and forecasting process by designing and formatting relevant templates and consolidate budget data
Analyze financial data and create financial models for decision support
Analyze past results, perform variance analysis, identify trends, and make recommendations for improvements and optimization
Work closely with the accounting team to ensure accurate financial reporting
Evaluate financial performance by comparing and analyzing actual results with plans and forecasts, and prepare for regular leadership review
Identify and drive process improvements, including the creation of standard and ad-hoc reports, tools, and dashboards
Identify and prepare business reporting requirements, validating for accuracy and integrity of the data being collected and reported

Post-secondary degree or diploma in Accounting is required
Must be enrolled in or in the process of completing the CPA certification program
2 to 5 years of previous work experience as a Financial Analyst or equivalent is required
Demonstrated business experience in analysis and/or reporting of financial data and with budgeting and forecasting is required
Proven ability to translate rough financial concepts into final reports or summaries for presentation to management is required
Advanced skills in Word, Excel, PowerPoint is required
Previous experience working in multi-disciplinary teams and with employees at all levels is required
Excellent communication (verbal and written), interpersonal, and relationship building skills required

About Exzell Pharma Inc.
With a mission to bring innovative products from around the world to the Canadian market, Exzell Pharma aims to provide new and effective treatment options in areas of unmet patient need. Founded in 2014 by a practicing physician and located in Markham, Exzell Pharma is an emerging OTC and prescription pharmaceutical company serving the Canadian market. Our growing portfolio of products include (i) Swiss Natural line of vitamins, minerals and supplements, (ii) Myoflex, a leading OTC topical for joint pain, (iii) Ozonol, a topical first aid treatment, (iv) the Salinex line of nasal care rinses, (v) PediaVit, a trusted brand of pediatric iron supplements and (vi) the recently introduced Esoph, an innovative product used as adjunct therapy in the management of gastroesophageal reflux disease.

Reporting to the Key Account Director, the Business Analyst Intern-Sales/Key Account is responsible for generating actionable insights from Exzell’s sales & customer data to improve customer service, identify opportunities to increase sales, enhance targeting of marketing efforts and determine the return on investment from our marketing campaigns. Job Family Group:
Data Analytics & Reporting
At BMO, we believe data assets and analytics capabilities are critically important to our ability to achieve our objective to be the bank that defines great customer experience. As the world’s data is doubling every two years, driven by the proliferation of the mobile, social networking and internet technologies, we are building our strategic capability to leverage the information required to create a distinctive customer experience and monitor our performance.
The Enterprise Data & AI (ED&AI) team, reporting to BMO’s Chief Data & Analytics Officer, is focused on developing and maintaining robust processes around critical data assets by partnering with data owners and key stakeholders.
The Data Governance Analyst role in the Enterprise Data Governance team within ED&AI is accountable for organizing and facilitating data governance activities related to the deployment of the Enterprise Data Governance Operating Model, supporting the Data Governance Leads in the subject areas in their duties to design/enhance and implement the Enterprise Data Governance capabilities, processes and tools as well as to drive the activities to improve the quality of BMO’s data and support strategic technology initiatives sponsored by subject corporate units.
Administratively, the position reports to a Senior Manager, Enterprise Data Governance and its key focus is to work closely with the assigned Data Governance Lead(s), data governance community members and working teams formed to deliver the data governance outcomes or data governance components in business-driven initiatives. The position is expected to support the Data Governance Leads and execute assignments related to various Lines of Business and Corporate Functions across Enterprise, in both Canada and US, on as required basis and as assigned by Senior Manager, Enterprise Data Governance.
In general, the Data Governance Analyst is accountable for
Operationalizing Data Governance
Understand all aspects of the subject data governance community(ies) and cross impacts with other communities and areas of the bank, educate the subject data governance communities and organizational partners on the data governance matters and enterprise data governance operating model, and support the operationalization of the enterprise data governance operating model and approved enterprise data governance methodologies, tools, processes and artifacts.
Supporting Data Quality Monitoring
Execute data quality intake process, including review of requirements and effective challenge of data quality rules submitted by subject business areas
Actively engage and lead communications with business and technology partners involved in the implementation, providing subject matter expertise, solution recommendations and relationship management support and where required use SQL/DQ tools to build DQ monitoring
Validate results and coordinate sign-off by the business and support post-implementation change management
Lead continuous improvement in reporting on data quality in subject data communities with the objective to provide solution recommendations
Facilitating Data Quality Remediation
Work with Data Governance Leads, Data Owners, Data Stakeholders, Data Stewards and Data Custodians where data quality issue remediation and prevention are concerned.
Participate in root cause analysis by querying the data, analysing the data lineage and figuring out the logical next step in the investigation till the root cause is found.
Crafting the remediation recommendation/action plan that balances regulatory, technology, change management and funding imperatives
Document and monitor the progress of the remediation action plan
Supporting documentation of CDE definitions, Metadata and Lineage
Review CDE definitions from Data Owners and Data Stakeholders, validate with existing definitions of similar terms in the glossary, define ownership and then add definitions to glossary, if required
Support physical metadata (table, field, schema details) and lineage documentation by Data Custodians
Facilitating Data Governance Reporting
Build reporting using Tableau, Spotfire, MS Excel etc. highlighting KPIs and KRIs of the various DG processes
Support Data Governance Leads in making decks (MS PowerPoint) for DG communities and meetings with Data Owners/ Data Stakeholders
Providing Thought Leadership & Deliverable Planning
Work closely with the members of the other ED&AI teams, technology and business partners in local jurisdictions to develop, evaluate and provide recommendations on implementation of various initiatives that affect the overall data quality of the Bank and improve the overall data infrastructure of the Bank.
Knowledge/ Role Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Engineering or Information Systems, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. A Master’s degree is preferred, as is experience with business analysis and/or systems analysis. Candidates not meeting the degree requirement should possess the equivalent of 15 years of relevant education and experience.
A minimum of five (5) years of combined experience in business analysis, data analysis, data management, change management, data quality management, audit and/or governance
Understanding of Data Governance and Data Quality Management
Working knowledge of any of the LOBs (Lending, Wealth, Capital Markets) and/or Corporate Functions (Risk, Finance, Audit, Compliance or AML functions), including key processes, key regulations governing risk and statutory and regulatory reporting (e.g. Basel II and III, RDARR/BCBS 239, IFRS, etc), key data dependencies/concerns and data risk controls typical for these corporate functions.
Knowledge and understanding of SQL, pseudocode, DQ tools (Info Analyzer, Atacama etc), Data Lineage, Data Glossary, Spotfire, Analytical tools like Datameer, SAS etc
Exposure to multiple business units in BMO’s environment to understand the linkages and dependencies is preferred
Knowledge and expertise in the use of project management methodologies and tools (e.g. Clarity, MS Project, SharePoint repositories, if applicable)
Skills:
Analytical Thinking (In-Depth)
Systematically breaks problems or processes into component parts, using several business analysis techniques. Analyses or plans have multiple dimensions for each component, each requiring the application of knowledge or various business and financial principles.
Business Numeracy (In-Depth)
Knowledge of undergraduate level mathematics and statistics and its application to business issues which has been enhanced through experience. The ability to translate between business issues and underlying data, and quickly recognize patterns and trends.
Change Leadership (In-Depth)
Understands the cultural dynamics of the current state of an organization including the hidden assumptions and the difference between the stated values and the values in practice. Brings current state of culture to light without paralyzing the organization and helps create a strategic practical course between the current reality and a desired future reality to exploit best advantage to change.
Organizational Understanding (In-Depth)
Understands, describes and navigates existing work structures and organizational systems, and makes recommendations with a clear sense of organizational impact. Possesses in-depth knowledge of bank systems that support product.
Problem-Solving (In-Depth)
The creative application of various rules, procedures, techniques, or principles to solve complex problems where there is no single correct answer.
Process Coordination and Management (Working)
Skilled in planning, coordinating, tracking, and controlling different parts of a complex process.

position.undefined: Senior Analyst Performance Analytics & Routing Strategy
position.description:
Toronto, ON
At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize her dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.
Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuels us, and moments define us.
The Senior Analyst Routing Performance will be responsible to deliver insights, actionable recommendations and to develop and implement the routing strategies that match callers with the optiminal Customer solution specialists to mitigate Customer friction while improving revenue and operational performance.
The successful candidate will explore improvement opportunities based on performed analysis and share this information with key partners across the organization including but not limited to: Care Performance, Workforce Planning, Operations, Marketing, Customer Base Management and IT teams.
Key Accountabilities:
Design and present weekly and monthly financial score cards of routing performance including insights of what is causing changes in trends
Manage, measure and monitor the business logic to optimize call routing and actions across frontline
Deliver routing strategy to optimize Customer and Agent pairings enabling the delivery of performance
Develop and maintain Customer segmentations, revenue and operational efficiency datasets to be used in analytics
Enable team members with key facts and insights to drive decision making
Qualifications:
5+ years experience dealing with data analytics and business intelligence, preferably in the telecommunications industry
Strong programming skills in SAS/Python/R and an expert in SQL
Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Data Modelling or equivalent
Passion for analyzing datasets and extracting actionable insights
Strong in communication and presentation skills
Ability to summarize and present outcomes in a way that non-technical people would understand
Self-motivated person with desire to go above and beyond tasks
Being pro-active when it comes to exploring opportunities for growth and improve our interactions with Customers
Team player with ability to collaborate in cross functional teams and build trust based on the work she/he performs
Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 333 Bloor Street East (012), Toronto, ON
Travel Requirements: Up to 10%
Posting Category/Function: Reporting and Analytics & Analyst
Requisition ID: 177450
Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:
Our people are at the heart of our success
Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
We do what’s right, each and every day
We believe in the power of new ideas
We work as one team, with one vision
We give back to our communities and protect our environment
What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.

About us:
Peoples Group has been providing financial services to the Canadian marketplace for over 30 years with offices in Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto and Montreal. Our mission is to exceed our customers’ expectations by providing exceptional customer service backed by extensive product knowledge and experience.
Our culture here at Peoples Group is formed by our values; Strength-Based, Relationship Focused and Passionate Execution. We believe people don't choose a company to work for, they choose a company to join. We also believe that people come first and each day we strive to be willing, trustworthy and creative.
About the opportunity:
Peoples Group is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst with 3-5 years of experience in data analysis developing business intelligence and reporting demonstrating detailed knowledge of BI functions such as analytics, data modeling & data mining, reporting, report conversion and data cleansing.
You will be responsible for analyzing data that is used by the business which supports decision-making and maximizes its utility. You comprehend business concepts and ensure these concepts are delivered as meaningful analytics. You will facilitate design and concept gathering and assist in the creation of new reports or analytics. As the Business Intelligence Analyst, you are experienced with problem-solving and conflict resolution to help identify, communicate and resolve issues.
About the day-to-day:
Driving the design, development and maintenance of the required management reports
Responsible to distribute accurate and timely Financial and Business reports that enhance the decision-making abilities for the Senior Management
Perform in depth analysis and commentary on key variances vs. targets and vs. prior months/years and recommendations for future action as required
Identify and recommend improvements to current processes, with a focus on increased efficiencies and enhanced value-added analytics
Introduce new analysis, reporting formats, etc. which provide insights to different areas of the business
Provide support on variety of special projects central to improving internal business processes
Maintain BI Documentation for all processes
Liaison between BI Development and Business users to lead requirements, data or report modelling and documentation
Extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources (SQL, S3, RedShift DB, Athena)
Facilitate prioritization and sprint planning sessions to ensure development work is aligned with business needs
Prepare ~15 periodic reports on Key Performance Indicator (KPI) metrics, highlighting performance trends, risks, and sales (Finance, Credit, Chargeback and Management Team)
Prepare ~20+ reports using SQL server and excel for monthly ISO commission payout
Educate business users on new reports and dashboards
Act as a subject matter expert for payment solutions and assist development team in the data integration
Design, build, support and enhance BI reporting to provide new insights
Desired skills and requirements:
Technical Skills:
Exposure to multidimensional databases, dashboards, scoreboards, SharePoint Online and Agile Development methodologies
Experience in writing SQL relational and multidimensional database queries and slicing and dicing data models
Ability to prototype and conceptualize the solution through visualization of data based on business requirements, using tools such as Microsoft PowerBI, Excel Power view, or other
Experience designing and developing dashboards and KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) using Power BI
Analytical Skills: Strong knowledge and experience in analyzing as well as designing data models that meet the reporting needs
Communication Skills:
Demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills with business and technical stakeholders
Strong interviewing and excellent listening skills and attention to detail and accuracy
Problem-Solving:
Able to troubleshoot BI reporting and analytic business needs and provide solutions for issue resolution
Demonstrate strong logical and technical problem-solving skills
Time Management:
Ability to work on large projects and many data streams and many deadlines. Being able to juggle it all is crucial to the job
Proven ability to conduct and/or lead multiple projects with minimal oversight
Proven record as a strong team player in a fast-paced, deadline driven, diverse environment; and
Exceptional interpersonal skills
Education and Experience:
3 years’ experience working with Business Intelligence tool(s)
Financial and payments knowledge strongly preferred
Expert in Microsoft Office- Excel, Word, Visio and PowerPoint, Strong VBA / Macros
Experience in the following technologies required: MS Power BI, SSRS, MS SQL Server, Excel Macros
NOTE: Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest; however only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Peoples Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.

Markham, ON
Job Title
Sales Planning Analyst
Job Description
Full Time - Sales Planning Analyst - Markham, ON - 2020
Are you interested in a full time opportunity with Philips? We welcome individuals who are currently pursuing or have recently completed an undergraduate (BS) and/or graduate (MS) degree to apply for full time opportunities at our sites across the US & Canada. Through these roles you will gain meaningful, hands-on experience in engineering for a HealthTech company.
Job Scope
Reporting to the Sr manager Sales Operations, the Sales Planning analyst is responsible for driving the alignment and execution of the sales and marketing plans for a specific category(s) or segment of the business in conjunction with the Sr. Sales Operations manager, where applicable.
He supports the development of commercial propositions for new product development initiatives and helps define channel strategies and channel objectives.
This position is key to gather and provide insights to drive alignment, execute the marketing strategy at the customer and maintain market equity.
This role is intended for candidates who are about to graduate or have graduated in the past 12 months.
Job Responsibilities
Act as a liaison between the Brand and Sales teams to ensure strategic alignment, and encourage collaboration.
Effectively using internal sales, market and consumer research data (where available), to develop actionable insights to drive better retail strategies as they relate to the 4 P’s with a focus on pricing and promotion.
Collaborate with Sr Manager Sales Operations and Marketing to develop promotional pricing by SKU in line with brand standards and customer’s key promotional vehicles.
Work with Marketing to develop channel strategy translating brand standards and must dos into activation.
Identify and develop programs and tools to increase brand presence, market share and improve customer satisfaction.
Maintain tools and information pertaining to the Go To Market process ensuring a consistent approach, structure, and framework for all categories.
Build distribution plans with marketing for new product launches and optimize product discontinuation plans with account managers and customer demand planners.
Monitor and evaluate trade programs and activities to measure effectiveness and make recommendation for improvements as needed.
To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience:
Bachelor’s Degree. A business focused degree is a plus
Strong Excel skills: build models, dashboards and macros
Previous experience in CPG industry desired
Retail trade/shopper marketing, category management/analytics or account sales experience
Enjoy working in a team environment, works well in a creative and entrepreneurial culture
Why should you join Philips?
Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways.
